title: Instant Pot Meatloaf Recipe
description: This instant pot meatloaf is topped with a sweet ketchup and mustard sauce and finished off under the broiler for a family-pleasing, comforting meal.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Meatloaf Recipes Beef Meatloaf Recipes Instant Pot Meatloaf 4.6 (70) 56 Reviews 16 Photos This Instant Pot meatloaf is quick to prepare and delicious. It's made a little sweet with apple. Submitted by Cybergy Updated on May 3, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 16 16 16 16 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings Meatloaf: 2 pounds ground beef 1 cup dry bread crumbs ½ cup diced onion ½ apple - peeled, cored, and diced 1 egg 2 teaspoons garlic powder ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon ground black pepper Topping: ⅓ cup ketchup 2 tablespoons prepared yellow mustard 2 tablespoons brown sugar Directions Make the meatloaf: Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, apple, egg, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until evenly blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Shape the beef mixture into a loaf and place on a large piece of aluminum foil. Fold the foil up and around the edges of the meatloaf, creating a makeshift loaf pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour 1/2 cup water into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and place the steam rack inside with the handles up. Place the meatloaf on top of the rack. Close and lock the lid; seal the vent. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 25 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Release cooker pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer meatloaf, still on the rack, to a baking sheet. Broil meatloaf in the oven until browned, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, make the topping: Combine ketchup, mustard, and brown sugar in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Brush over meatloaf and broil again until caramelized, 1 to 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 150 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 295 Calories 15g Fat 19g Carbs 22g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 295 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 6g 28% Cholesterol 71mg 24% Sodium 466mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 19g 7% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 8g Protein 22g 43% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 44mg 3% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 338mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Meatloaf 01 of 16 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 16 Photo by  Calvin Emanuel 12/21/2023 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite 03 of 16 Photo by  Diane Butters 12/28/2020 I used ground turkey. And I would not use as much mustard. I will definitely make it again. 04 of 16 Photo by  Kiersten Norbrothen 03/26/2020 05 of 16 Photo by  Lynn Farmakoulas 02/02/2020 Husband approved. I like the apple in it. I used a package of onion soup mix instead of chopped onion and added 1/4 cup of Steak sauce. I cooked the meatloaf for 30 minutes, then quick release. I didn’t put it under the broiler before I glazed it. I glazed it, then put it under the broiler for a couple of minutes. I put some baby white potatoes at the bottom of the pot, used 1 cup beef broth. The potatoes were perfect. 06 of 16 Photo by  Phil 01/15/2020 07 of 16 Photo by  Meadowsweet Rider 12/03/2019 i used my Mealthy. Just placed the hot air fryer on after the pressure cook and done. All one one device. Meat was tender and flavorful. Will make again! 08 of 16 Photo by  Debi Blanco 11/06/2019 I used ground turkey and added red and yellow peppers 09 of 16 Photo by  Mandii Rocca 09/28/2019 10 of 16 Photo by  John Longest 08/28/2019 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Air Fryer Meatloaf 72 Ratings Flavorized Slow Cooker Meatloaf 20 Ratings Stuffing Meatloaf with a Sweet Glaze 4 Ratings New Mexico Green Chile Meatloaf 11 Ratings Make-Ahead Meatloaf Muffins 2 Ratings Italian Mozzarella-Stuffed Meatloaf 12 Ratings Michelle's Marvelous Mini Meatloaves 73 Ratings French Onion Meatloaf 6 Ratings Beef Peach Pie 125 Ratings Instant Pot Beef Panang Curry 1 Rating Meatloaf California 58 Ratings Dill Pickle Meatloaf 376 Ratings Brown Sugar Meatloaf with Ketchup Glaze 162 Ratings Heavenly Meatloaf with Blue Cheese, Mushrooms, and Spinach 53 Ratings Healthier Easy Meatloaf 18 Ratings Instant Pot Mexican Beef Taco Filling 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
